definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to approve by nodding one's head and smacking one's lips (idiom)

sentences.english: Janice evaded Minmei's embrace, and nodded coolly.
sentences.chinese: 贾妮斯避开了她的拥抱礼，冷淡地点点头致意。

sentences.english: The safest form is to nod and give a verbal salutation.
sentences.chinese: 最安全的方式就是点头，并给予口头称呼。

sentences.english: Would you like some soup or appetizer to start with you meal ?
sentences.chinese: 请问你要不要先点头盘或汤？

sentences.english: Nine younger sister listen to happy old man say that finish context, immediately agreed.
sentences.chinese: 九妹听神医老人说完前因后果，立即点头答应。
愚蠢的地精急切地点点头。

sentences.english: The summer spring beloved mandated to nod this time.
sentences.chinese: 夏泉这一次乖乖的点了点头。

sentences.english: He nodded, and looked at me for a second.
sentences.chinese: 他点点头，盯着我看了一会儿。

sentences.english: The boatman nodded towards the north of the bay with some disdain.
sentences.chinese: 船老大略带轻蔑神情朝海湾北部点了点头。
他向这位女作家点点头。

sentences.english: Don’t just stand there nodding and answer with short sentences.
sentences.chinese: 不要只是在那里点头或者问简短的问题。

sentences.english: Sister Mary nodded and winked back.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽修女也点点头挤了挤眼睛。

sentences.english: I nodded. I knew I could not hesitate any more.
sentences.chinese: 我点点头，我知道我不能再这样犹豫下去了。

sentences.english: He has a stern face and he simply nods before shooting off into the gathering darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他一脸严肃地点点头，开车驶入越来越浓的夜色中。

definition: first time/first (round, course, coat of paint etc)
to have heard what was said
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
to have a smile on one's face
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
tone of voice/the way one speaks/manner of expression/tone
